definitions.definition: assume that something is the case on the basis of evidence or probability but without proof or certain knowledge.
examples: I suppose I got there about half past eleven
synonyms: gather; formalopine "I suppose he's used to this"apparent

definitions.definition: used to make a reluctant or hesitant admission.
examples: I'm quite a good actress, I suppose

definitions.definition: used to introduce a hypothesis and trace or ask about what follows from it.
examples: suppose he had been murdered—what then?
suppose we leave this to the police

definitions.definition: (of a theory or argument) assume or require that something is the case as a precondition.
examples: the procedure supposes that a will has already been proved

definitions.definition: believe to exist or to possess a specified characteristic.
examples: he supposed the girl to be about twelve

definitions.definition: be required to do something because of the position one is in or an agreement one has made.
examples: I'm supposed to be meeting someone at the airport
synonyms: obliged "I'm supposed to meet him at 8

examples: I shouldn't have been in the kitchen—I'm not supposed to go in there
